name: superficiality
content:
superficiality noun
(LACK OF IMPORTANCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the fact of never thinking about things that are serious or important: He was accused of superficiality, unreliability, and a lack of convictions. It's amazing how having a baby takes away any superficiality or vanity.
[ U or C ] usually disapproving the fact of seeming to be good or important, but of having no real value: She contrasted the superficiality of celebrity life with the satisfaction of social activism. She can see beyond the superficialities of a society obsessed with money, class, and social mores.
